description: A powerful keyboard customizer for macOS that allows complex key remapping and modifications through JSON configuration
rules: Karabiner-Elements uses JSON configuration files stored at ~/.config/karabiner/karabiner.json
Complex modifications use manipulators with 'from' and 'to' event definitions
The 'from' event defines what input to capture (key_code, consumer_key_code, pointing_button, or any)
The 'to' event defines what output to generate (can include key events, shell commands, mouse control, etc.)
Conditions control when manipulators activate (application, device, variable, input source based)
Use 'to_if_alone' for dual-purpose keys (e.g., Caps Lock as Escape when tapped, Control when held)
Use 'to_if_held_down' for actions that trigger when a key is held
Use 'to_delayed_action' for time-based logic and multi-tap detection
Variables enable state management between key presses for complex multi-step shortcuts
Manipulators are evaluated top to bottom - first match wins
Use 'lazy': true when creating dual-purpose modifier keys to prevent immediate modifier sending
Always escape dots in bundle identifiers for application conditions: com\.apple\.Terminal
The 'halt' property stops further event processing in specific contexts
Use EventViewer to find key codes, bundle identifiers, and debug configurations
